Detailed Description

template<class T>
class CALICE::MappedContainer< T >

Container for fast access by index.

This class stores arbitrary data types and offers transparent access by different coordinate systems.

Author:
Benjamin.Lutz@desy.de
Version:
1.3
Date:
November 2009

const bool  deleteElements = true 
) [inline]

Constructor.

Parameters:
[in] mapper Mapper object that is used to translate coordinate systems
[in] deleteElements Determines if the object behind the stored reference should be deleted, when it is removed from the container.

template<class T >
void CALICE::MappedContainer< T >::fillByCellID ( const int  cellID,
T *  object,
bool  unique = true 
) [inline]

fill content for (Mokka) cellID

If unique is set, an already set value cannot be overwritten and an exception is thrown. Otherwise, the old value gets overwritten.

Parameters:
[in] cellID coordinate for content as (Mokka) cellID see Mapper
[in] object data to be stored
[in] unique enables protection from overwriting
Exceptions:
BadDataException

template<class T>
DecoderSet* CALICE::MappedContainer< T >::getDecoder (  )  [inline]

return a pointer to the DecoderSet handling the decoding of IDs with encoding strings

This function returns a pointer to the DecoderSet used by the Mapper. This allows to change the used encoding string. Be aware that the DecoderSet might be the same for many Objects using the same Mapper. Therefore, you should always enfore your encoding before using the MappedContainer.

Definition at line 59 of file MappedContainer.hh.

References CALICE::Mapper::getDecoder().
